N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 347.12 - Reporting support collections for public assistance, medical assistance-only and foster care cases

State Regulations
(a) Where support is collected for a public
assistance, medical assistance-only, or foster care case with respect to a
recipient for whom an assignment of support rights under section
369.2, 370.2, 360-3.2, or
426.8
of this Title is effective, such collections received by the support collection unit shall be distributed
and disbursed to the social services district and shall not be distributed and
disbursed directly to the family except as provided in subdivision (b) of this
section. (b) In any case in which
support is collected for a recipient of public assistance with respect to whom
an assignment of support rights under section 369.2 or
370.2
of this Title is effective, and where arrears are due to the family pursuant to section
347.13
of this Part, such
collections on those arrears shall be distributed and disbursed directly to the
family. (c) An amount which
represents the required monthly support obligation for one month, or the cash
medical support obligation for one month in a medical assistance-only case, must be determined from the order of support. If the order of support is set
out in a frequency other than monthly, it must be converted to an amount which
represents the required monthly support obligation. (d) Any amount collected in a month which
exceeds the required monthly support obligation or the cash medical support
obligation determined pursuant to subdivision (c) of this section represents a
collection towards the required monthly support obligation or cash medical
support obligation for past months. (e) As soon as possible, but not later than
10 business days after the end of a month, the support collection unit will
inform the public assistance unit, the medical-assistance unit and foster care
unit of the social services district of the amount of the collection which
represents payment on the required monthly support obligation for that month, or the cash medical support obligation for that month in a medical
assistance-only case, and for past months as determined pursuant to section
347.13
of this Part. (f) When the public assistance unit is
informed of the amount pursuant to subdivision (e) of this section, the public
assistance unit must determine pursuant to section
352.31
(a)(6)
of
this Title if the amount collected will affect the family's eligibility for
public assistance payments. If the amount collected represents payment on the
required monthly support obligation for that month and is sufficient to make
the family ineligible for a public assistance payment pursuant to this Title, the public assistance unit must notify the support collection unit of such
fact, except in those cases pursuant to Part 358 of this Title in which a
family is nevertheless entitled to a public assistance payment pending the
result of a hearing. (g) Upon
notice from the public assistance unit that the family is no longer eligible
for public assistance pursuant to subdivision (f) of this section, or upon
notice from the medical assistance or foster care units that the family is no
longer in receipt of medical assistance or that foster care maintenance
payments have terminated, the support collection unit must notify the family
pursuant to section
347.17
of this Part that the
support collection unit will continue to distribute and disburse collections
received pursuant to section
347.13
of this Part. (h) Where the entire amount of support
collected is distributed and disbursed to the social services district pursuant
to subdivision (a) of this section and that disbursement exceeds the cumulative
amount that the family actually received as public assistance, such excess
shall be paid to the family pursuant to section
352.15
(c) of this
